channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: More fly tipping, 7th January
item.description:
Yet again more fly tipping. This will continue until as a council you start to isdue fines. You need temporary cameras installed.

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Brampton Road, Bexleyheath
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Fly tipping in communal garden, 7th January
item.description:
I am reporting a large rubbish pile in the shared communal front garden on our road. This land is communal and part of social housing, not private land belonging to me. All properties on the road share this front garden. The pile started small but has grown significantly because unknown neighbours have been dumping their own items there. I have not placed this waste there myself and I do not have control over who uses the area. I am disabled (ADHD) and currently on benefits, and I am not financially or physically able to arrange private waste removal. The rubbish is becoming an eyesore and is causing distress, as well as potential health and safety concerns. Please can this be treated as fly-tipping on communal land and arranged for removal. I would also appreciate any steps that can be taken to prevent further dumping in this area. Thank you for your help.
Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Westhorne Avenue, Eltham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Fly tipping, 7th January
item.description:
Ceres Road and Kashgar Road is fly tippers ground. These refuse sacks are blocking pavement and it is spreading filth everywhere. Any chance this corner can have a camera to monitor te street both ways and corners. It is a path used by children and parents for school run every day. There is not a single day this road is clean.

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Ceres Road, Plumstead
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Dumped rubbish and abandoned bin, 7th January
item.description:
This looks like a missed bin. Has been there at least for 10 days and the rubbish around it is growing. Any chance this corner can be controlled with camera so fly tippers can be stopped.

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Kashgar Road, Plumstead

item.title: Flytipping junction Lessness Park an Heron Hill, 7th January
item.description:
A mattress and a couple of pillows have been dumped on the pavement on the junction of Lessness Park and Heron Hill. It is leaning up against the fence. It has been there for a couple of days . Please can this be removed asap.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Lessness Park, Lessness Heath, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Outside no.19, 7th January
item.description:
There is a vulnerable young tree that needs restaking. The tree is now leaning and isn't being supported. It has barely grown since it was planted three years ago. The watering bag disappeared over a year ago.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Chetwynd Road, Dartmouth Park, Greater London

item.title: Ungritted pavement on Waterloo Bridge, 7th January
item.description:
Pavement on Waterloo Bridge was not gritted this morning and was therefore covered in black ice. Pedestrians were forced to walk in the road which is equally dangerous. Please grit the pavement when conditions require it.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 1, Charlie Chaplin Walk, Waterloo, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Pothole, 7th January
item.description:
This hole has been in the carpark for years I wouldn't care but I pay for a pass to park my car out side my home what IAM I paying for pls can you send someone out to look at it
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Tudor Road, Ponders End, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Highway issue regarding curr3nt upgrading of water/gas mains, 7th January
item.description:
Their caged off area is in a very dangerous position and on double yellow lines. It should be moved further into the Crescent adjacent to the wall between No 2a and the main entrance to Cold Blow Crescent. There have already been two dangerous incidents one when the spoil lorry was blocking the entrance and trying to manoeuvre. There was also spoil left on the road. I cannot believe how any sane person could have sanctioned this especially as the double yellow lines were put there in the first place to alleviate problems. I also suggest that no parking cones are placed to stop parking up to 2a - none of these cars, vans and lorries belong to CBC residents. Thank you for hopefully a speedy response. No 9 CBC.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Cold Blow Crescent, Coldblow, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Blocked drain, 7th January
item.description:
The blocked drain in Willersley park has caused a puddle which is now frozen. The whole footpath has thick ice and is a real hazard. I have reported the blocked drain several times but nothing is ever done. Can you please unblock the drain before someone is seriously hurt?

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Acacia Way, Blackfen, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Fly tipping in Edge Hill, 7th January
item.description:
The road is being used as a rubbish dump with several vehicles piled high with waste. Also bicycles chain to rail and a sign saying for sale. The scale of this rubbish store and commercial activity/operation is out of keeping with residential street. Reported previously and post deleted without resolution.

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Edge Hill, Woolwich
Report on FixMyStreet
